articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Over 60 people were injured, some of them seriously, when a vehicle drove through crowds gathered at the market.
articles.title: Death toll from German Christmas market car-ramming rises to four, Bild reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Here is what we know so far about the man who was arrested as the suspected driver in a car-ramming attack on Friday at a Christmas market in the German city of Magdeburg in which five people were killed and some 200 injured.
articles.title: Germany Christmas market attack: what we know about the suspect

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: A spontaneous memorial created by grieving families and local residents at a church overlooking Magdeburg's Christmas market evolved during Saturday into something more politically charged.
articles.title: First grief, then a more political tone at site of Germany Christmas market attack

articles.author: Orhan Qereman, Tom Perry, Tuvan Gumrukcu
articles.description: With hostile Turkish-backed groups mobilising against them in Syria's north, and Damascus ruled by a group friendly to Ankara, Syria's main Kurdish factions are on the back foot as they seek to preserve political gains carved out during 13 years of war.
articles.title: Syrian Kurdish groups on the back foot as power balance shifts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Congress was scrambling to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday, hours after more than three dozen Republicans rejected a demand by President-elect Donald Trump to use the measure to lift the nation's debt ceiling.
articles.title: US Congress scrambles to try to avert looming shutdown after Trump demand rejected

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis on Saturday again condemned Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, a day after an Israeli government minister publicly denounced the pontiff for suggesting the global community should study whether the military offensive there constitutes a genocide of the Palestinian people.
articles.title: Pope calls Gaza airstrikes 'cruelty' after Israeli minister's criticism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria's new rulers have appointed Murhaf Abu Qasra, a leading figure in the insurgency which toppled Bashar al-Assad, as defence minister in the interim government, an official source said on Saturday.
articles.title: Syria's new rulers name HTS commander as defence minister

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's political options have narrowed after the leader of a small party that has helped keep his Liberal minority government in power said on Friday he would present a formal motion of no-confidence in parliament.
articles.title: The rise and fall of Canadian PM Trudeau's political fortunes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones attacked the Russian city of Kazan and the airport there was temporarily closed, Russian media and aviation authorities said on Saturday.
articles.title: Ukraine drone attack on Russian city of Kazan forces airport closure, media and aviation watchdog say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Suspected jihadists killed more than 20 people in a string of attacks on villages in central Mali's insurgency-hit Mopti region on Friday, two local sources said.
articles.title: Over 20 civilians killed in central Mali village attacks
